pullrequest.title: Patches to complete compilation on Windows

content.raw:
Umm interesting. It [seems totally necessary](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/948/console) on windows.

The symbol is there:
```
nm -D /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-7/plugins/libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so | grep gui
                 U _ZN6gazebo3gui15get_main_windowEv
```
No link to gazebo_gui.
```
ldd /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-7/plugins/libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so | grep gazebo_gui
```

Not entirely sure about this but could happen that [since all our exectuables](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo7-debbuilder/407/consoleFull) are being built with -rdynamic, the executable is exposing all the symbols to the symbol table and the plugin, loaded using ldopen, can read them from there.
content.html:
Umm interesting. It seems totally necessary on windows.

The symbol is there:

nm -D /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-7/plugins/libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so | grep gui
                 U _ZN6gazebo3gui15get_main_windowEv

No link to gazebo_gui.

ldd /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-7/plugins/libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so | grep gazebo_gui

Not entirely sure about this but could happen that since all our exectuables are being built with -rdynamic, the executable is exposing all the symbols to the symbol table and the plugin, loaded using ldopen, can read them from there.
